intro: Dipcadi tacazzeanum, commonly known as the Tacazze buttercup, is a rare flowering plant native to the highlands of Ethiopia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, characterized by its showy, often yellow or white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at elevations above 2,000 meters. It has basal leaves that are palmately lobed, and its flowers are usually solitary, with five petals. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
